thread.section_title: The Union Democrat, Sonora, CA News, Sports, & Weather
thread.title: News of Record for Oct. 14, 2015

title: News of Record for Oct. 14, 2015
text: News of Record for Oct. 14, 2015 News of Record for Oct. 14, 2015 By Union Democrat staff October 14, 2015 01:00 am TUOLUMNE COUNTY The Sonora Police Department reported the following: MONDAY 9:12 a.m., school assist — An out-of-control student threw things inside a South Washington Street building. 9:37 a.m., civil problem — A South Green Street person would not stop running water. 10:25 a.m., suspicious circumstance — A woman was harassed by a man in front of her friend’s West Stockton Street home. 10:27 a.m., theft — A Greenley Road man’s paycheck was stolen, forged and cashed. 10:53 a.m., threats — A man continuously called a Mono Way business and harassed employees. 10:58 a.m., animal complaints — A possibly pregnant feral cat stayed in a vacant Greenley Road residence. 9:46 p.m., warrant arrests — Two men possibly slept inside the storage area of a South Washington Street business. The Sheriff’s Office reported the following: MONDAY 12:07 a.m., Columbia — A Woods Creek Way woman heard something come up to her window, and when she called out there was no response. 1:43 a.m., Sonora area — A woman slept inside her vehicle parked on Standard Road. 2:45 a.m., Sonora area — Two bald men wearing hoodies walked in the middle of Phoenix Lake Road with flashlights. 11:43 a.m., Sonora area — A person was suspected of stealing from a Wards Ferry Road park. 3:11 p.m., Tuolumne — A woman at a Tuolumne Road North business said she was looking for her husband, Mick Jagger, whose “soul hops from one person to another.” She said she also believed she had multiple souls, and one of her souls, Jesus Christ, had PTSD from being crucified. 4:47 p.m., Groveland — A Highway 120 woman tracked her lost cellphone to a Priest Coulterville Road address. 5:38 p.m., Sonora area — A Sunny Ridge Lane residence was burglarized. 7:02 p.m., Groveland — Two men wearing masks drove by a Mueller Drive residence. 7:21 p.m., Jamestown — A man slept in a Main Street parking lot. 7:50 p.m., Sonora area — A Crystal Falls Drive person smelled “something like meth” in the area. 9:28 p.m., Sonora area — A Sommette Drive man believed someone was outside. 9:48 p.m., Sonora area — Lights were on inside a Fallview Drive vacation home. 11:46 p.m., Tuolumne — A person refused to leave a Tuolumne Road North business. Felony bookings
